prompt: <description>3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. The dimensions are approximately 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. The front face is slightly tilted, creating a sense of depth. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing six lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] - Line 3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.75, 0.375] - Line 4: Start Point [0.75, 0.375], End Point [0.75, 0.75] - Line 5: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by a depth of 0.375 units. Part 2: Create a second rectangular prism that fits inside the first prism, with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties, based on the previous coordinate system but with a slight translation along the Z-axis: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0028, 0.75, 0.375] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3652, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.3652, 0.0], End Point [0.3652, 0.3652] - Line 3: Start Point [0.3652, 0.3652], End Point [0.0, 0.3652] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3652], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3652. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by a depth of 0.75 units. 7. Join the second prism (Part 2) with the first prism (Part 1) to create the final 3D model.</description>
